page.title: 09The Everholm
page.content: The{Everholm}is a large flat piece of ground on the eastern bank of the river close to the town centre. It used to be part of the grounds of the castle at the Moat. For many years the land was used for grazing cattle but in 1975 the new District Council had the idea of making it into a sports ground and riverside park. It took until 1980 to get the idea started but now there are lots of attractive features there. Each year new things are added to make it better. There is now a{trim track, football, hockey}and {rugby pitches}as well as an{athletics {circuit.}Many sports clubs and individuals make use of these fine new facilities. It is also used for some { {Riding of the Marches}events like the{ {Cornet's Chase}and the{Raft Race.
